intro: Hibbertia virentum, commonly known as the green-flowered hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in regions with a Mediterranean climate. Hibbertia virentum has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, greenish-yellow blooms that attract pollinators. It is a relatively hardy species that thrives in well-drained conditions and full sun.
